description.en: The lecture course elaborates on selected topics in Einstein´s theory of gravity and its generalisations.
description.et: Loengukursuses käsitletakse valitud küsimusi Einsteini gravitatsiooniteooriast ja selle üldistustest.

objectives.en: The purpose of the lecture course is to acquaint the students with the currently hot topics in the gravitation theory research.
objectives.et: Loengukursuse eesmärk on tutvustada üliõpilastele gravitatsiooniteooriate vallas parasjagu akutaalseid uurimissuundi.

learning_outcomes.en: - has gained an introduction to and overview of some currently hot topics in the research of gravitation;
learning_outcomes.et: - on saanud sissejuhatuse ja ülevaate gravitatsiooniteooriate vallas parasjagu aktuaalsetest uurmissuundadest,

learning_outcomes.en: - has acquainted with the relevant literature and is able to perform the main calculations in the field.
learning_outcomes.et: - on tuttav teemakohase kirjandusega ning oskab teha olulisemaid arvutusi sel alal.

description.et: Schwarzschild black hole reminder, coordinate systems for Schwarzschild black holes, maximally extended solution, Kruskal and Carter-Penrose conformal diagrams [Martin Krššák, online]
More general black holes, Reissner-Nordstrom and Kerr solutions, naked singularities, Kruskal and conformal diagrams, Penrose process [Martin Krššák, online]
Laws of black hole mechanics, Smarr law, black hole thermodynamics [Martin Krššák, online]
Hypersurfaces, normal vectors and induced metrics, Stokes’ theorem, Gauss-Codazzi equations and initial value problem [Martin Krššák, online]
Geodesic congruences, energy conditions, Raychaudhuri equation, focusing theorem, null congruences [Martin Krššák, online]
3+1 or ADM formalism in general relativity: constraint equations, evolution equations, example in spherical symmetry [María José Guzmán Monsalve]

Different formulations of GR: Gamma-Gamma linear formulation (+motivation for Gibbons-Hawking-York boundary term), different actions with equivalent results; Palatini and tetrad formulation [Sotirios Karamitsos]
Introduction to Dirac-Bergmann algorithm for constrained Hamiltonian systems. Hamilton’s equations. Diverse examples in mechanics and field theory [María José Guzmán Monsalve]
Hamiltonian formulation of GR. Boundary terms. ADM mass [María José Guzmán Monsalve]
Noether theorem and connection with Hamiltonian formalism. Motivations for modified gravity [María José Guzmán Monsalve]

f(R) theories; equations of motion, modification of effective matter content ; Brans-Dicke equivalent through Legendre transformations; motivation for more general scalar-tensor theories [Sotirios Karamitsos]
Conformal freedom; reparametrization invariance, conformal transformations, and unit transformations; field space metric and scalar-tensor theory space [Sotirios Karamitsos]

Applications to observables/inflation; brief overview of observables in scalar tensor theories and invariance; a few illustrative examples (Starobinsky, Higgs, IGI, -attractors, universality classes of inflation) [Sotirios Karamitsos]
